meanings.definition: A fabric made of knotted threads
meanings.sent1: The nete was soft and warm, perfect for a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful nete scarf to keep her neck warm.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten got tangled in the nete and couldn't escape!
meanings.sent4: The nete of friendships intertwined to create a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The intricate nete design on the pillow was eye-catching.

meanings.sent1: After paying all the bills, she had a small nete amount left in her wallet.
meanings.sent2: The nete balance in his bank account was enough for a simple meal.
meanings.sent3: The nete piece of cake was saved for her best friend.
meanings.sent4: His nete energy was spent on finishing the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The nete time remaining was just enough to catch the bus.

meanings.definition: To catch or ensnare in a net
meanings.sent1: The fisherman tried to nete the fish in the river.
meanings.sent2: She managed to nete the butterfly gently in her hands.
meanings.sent3: He tried to nete the runaway balloon before it flew away.
meanings.sent4: The spider quickly neted the fly in its web for dinner.
meanings.sent5: The detective hoped to nete the criminal before they escaped.
